inn1.comm: Looking for inswing, fullish, on the middle stump line, it curves in a touch, Gayle leans forward, without moving his feet, pushes it out towardes mid-on. The midwicket fielder gets across to make a tumbling stop
Inswing there, but it drifts towards middle and leg, again Gayle leans forward and this time wrists it past square-leg
on a length, outside off stump, Smith hops back, taps it to third man
squared-up. It landed on the leg and middle, on a length and moved towards middle, Gayle was looking to work it to on side, gets a leading edge to point.
Smell that! Bouncer, not quite a perfume ball as it went over Gayle who ducked under.
short in length, on the middle stump line, shapes in, tucked to square-leg
on the off stump line, steered to point
The left-arm seamer, hurls one on the off and middle stump line, Smith leans forward, pushes it out to the off side
curves away in the channel outside off stump, left alone
full, bit of outswing, but it starts early in the trajectory and Smith has enough time to thrust forward, wait for the swing to play out and pushed it through cover.
outside off stump, again a touch early swing, Smith thinks about playing a shot but shoulders arms in the end.
and again. Outswinger that curved away, left alone by Smith. There were two slips waiting for a mistake but it didn't come in this over.
swinging down the leg side. Bowden extends his arms.
on the middle and leg, at the hips, Gayle stabs at it, misses, and it rolls over the leg side off the thigh pad and they steal a single
angled across Smith, slightly back of length, Smith hops back, as his wont, punches to cover

on the middle stump line, on a length, goes on straight, Smith hops back, is cramped for the room as the ball straightens and climbs up, he takes out the bottom-hand off the handle, nudges the ball to the on side
fuller, on the middle, again a touch of inswing, Smith stays back, waits for the swing and wrists it past square-leg
short in length, Smith jumps back, gets on top of the bounce, almost slips in the process, turns it to midwicket

Cracker! Cleans him up! The fuller length did the trick. Landed on the middle and off stump line, goes on with the angle, Smith is caught at the crease and he tries to work it to on side, the ball evades the waft and crashes into the off stump. Very nice from Mortaza. He had been getting the ball to bend in to the left-hand batsmen so far but this one went on straight and that fooled Smith. He ended up playing a ugly waft across the line.
full-pitched, on the off and middle line, swings away a touch, pushed to the off side.
fullish again, on the off stump line, dabbed back down the track.
on a length, around the off stump, patted towards point. Rasel doesn't quite his right arm high up, sort of falls over but the left arm gets over and down pretty nicely. Good wrist position as well.

beaten. Cuts the ball with the fingers across the seam. It bends in after landing on a length, outside off stump, Gayle drives outside the line and the ball goes between the bat and pad gap and rushes past the off stump

Gone! Gayle's horrible run continues. Full in length, it landed on the off stump line and straightened, the bat, again, came outside the line and the ball thudded into the pad in front of off stump. It was hitting off. Gayle has to go and Bangladesh have struck early and how. The openers are back in the hut.
Pushes it across Samuels, who shuffles across, sees the line and shoulders arms

huge shout for lbw. Chanderpaul didn't offer a stroke. It landed on a length, on the off stump, straightened, Chanderpaul shoulders arms and the ball comes in a touch and strikes him outside off stump, on the left thigh.
In the channel outside of stump, kicks up, Chanderpaul gets his bat inside the line, lets it go through to Rahim
slips on the legs, flicked past square-leg
On the legs again, glanced fine. Very fine.
full and on the off stump line, Chanderpaul is bit late in moving forward and pushes it out towards cover
on the off stump line, Samuels shuffles across, pushes to point
beaten. slanting away from Samuels- the classic left-armers angle, Samuels has a poke at it.
on the off stump line, pushed to cover. Lots of chirpy talk from the fielders. And as usual, Rahim, the wicketkeeper, says a lot. He is quite a chirpy character.
angling away from Samuels who lets Rahim gather it.
Dropped Full and outside off, in the temptation zone, Samuels is sucked into a flash, gets a outside edge and it flies low and to right of second slip who couldn't hold on to it.
beaten. In the zone outside off stump, and it holds its line, Samuels pushes inside the line and is beaten by the straightening of the delivery
on the off stump line, Samuels goes back, pats it back down the track
And again
rushes through the corridor, Samuels withdraws his bat from the line and lets it swing past him
on the leg stump line, turned to the on side
beaten again. Deja-vu at Barbados. Samuels has another stab at the dark to a length-delivery outside off stump that holds its line.
nice probing delivery outside off stump. He bowls a lot like Irfan Pathan. Ie when Pathan used to bowl well. Lovely shape away from a left-hand batsman. Lovely control. Not much pace though.
on the middle and leg, worked past square-leg
lands outside off stump, slants away, left alone
full-pitched outside off stump, outside off stump, Samuels leans forward, dabs it to off side
fullish, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off.
pushed across Samuels, left alone
leading edge. Fullish, on the middle stump line, Chanders tries to whip it to on side, gets a leading edge, and the ball goes in the air and rolls towards mid-off
lands on a length, around middle and off, shapes in a touch, pushed back down the track
on the off stump line, nagging line and length, Chanders shuffles across and defends.
fuller and in the channel outside off stump line, Chanderpaul covers his off stump and lets it whizz past him to the 'keeper
inswing. Fullish, on the middle stump line, curves in late, flicked to square-leg
rushes past the off stump , left alone
on the off stump line, defended on the front foot.
full-pitched outside off stump, curves away, left alone
fullish, on the off stump line, comes in a touch, Chanderpaul leans forward, pushes his bat out, pats the ball to mid-off
on a length, outside off stump, shapes away and Chanderpaul lets it go through to the chirpy Rahim
And again
on the off stump line, on a length, Samuels hops across, pushes it out to point
swing and a miss. Samuels has run out of patience. Has a flash at a length-delivery well outside off stump and is beaten.
fullish, on the off stump line, Samuels gets back, defends
on the middle stump line, on a length, worked past square-leg
well outside off stump, left alone
slower one, again on a great length and slanting past him, he looks to flick across the line but adjusts to play it back to Rasel
good length moving across off stump, this time he does manage to get over it and flick, but cant beat midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, he gets back and defends to the off side
strays to leg stump, he flicks but again cant beat square leg
too full, overpitched outside off stump, theres a nice-looking drive but he just cant beat the fielders anywhere
good length just outside off stump, he drops the hands and wants one into the cover, but Chanderpaul wisely says no thank you
back of a length well outside off stump, swings a way a lot, and Bowden says that'll be a wide
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up on the toes and steers it straight to gulley
good ball, rising off of a shortish length outside off stump, Chanderpaul shuffles across and then shoulders arms
back of a length outside off stump and moving away, deliberately he pulls the bat out of the way as it seams past him
back of a length again, this time he hops across and is almost squared up, the ball rolls to Aftab at backward point
short of a length outside off stump, he leaves it be with a confident shuffle to off
back of a length outside off stump again, and once more he has nothing to do with it
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside off stump, he gets behind it, stands tall, and punches off the back foot past the bowler and stumps for runs, the slow outfield holds the ball up near long-off
back of a length again, this time he drives with a flourish from his crease but cant beat mid-off
good length on off stump, he stands and drives to cover this time
fractionally overpitched, he square-drives hard to point
overpitched again, he swings across the line, connects well, and picks up four over mid-on, fine shot
on the leg, flicked past square-leg
Beaten. Quicker one, outsidse the off stump, full in length, Samuels tries to hit on the up.
flat, on the middle stump line, turns away, Samuels adjusts to push it away to the off side
again quick, on the off and middle, punched to cover
slower this time, lands on off stump line, turns away, pushed to cover point

huge shout for lbw. Arm-ball. Lands on the middle stump line, goes on straight, Samuels stabs at it in a hurry and it rams into the pad and then onto the  inside-edge and bobs away to the leg side. That was close. Not given.
on the middle and leg, turned to the leg side
lands on a length, around off stump line, pushed to the leg side. Rahim likes that delivery, clears his throat in appreciation
on the off stump line, steered to point. Tuk- tuk cricket continues.
well outside off stump, slightly short in length, cut down to third man
Again bit of width outside off stump, cut away through backward point. Rafique gets around from third man but the slide goes awry and he ends up pushing it beyond the ropes
short and wide, Rasel gift-wraps a boundary. Samuels cut in through cover point this time. Suddenly, out of the blue, two boundaries have come. Will we see Windies press the accelerator now?
on the middle stump line, leans forward to defend
turns in from outside off, Chanders goes back, turns it to midwicket
similar delivery, this time worked past midwicket, to left of mid-on
on the middle and leg, tickled behind square-leg
quicker, on the middle and leg, Chanderpaul stabs at it, misses and it thuds into the pad. Hmm.... another tight over.
floats in from round the stumps, defended on the front foot to cover
arm-ball, on the off and middle, punched to cover
The squeeze continues. Slower this time, on the middle stump line, tapped to the on side
flighted, fullish, driven down the ground
comes in from outside off, dabbed down the track.
on the middle line, pushed to right of mid-on for a single. Rahim screams at the midwicket fielder to get across, "Saqib Saqib!" but our man is unable to get across in time.
on the middle and leg, driven to mid-on
beaten beauty. Slower in the air, it floated on the off and middle, landed, gripped and then turned away sharply
straighter, on the off  and middle, hit back down the track
fullish, on the off stump line, driven to long-off where there is a mis-field
on the middle and leg, tucked past square-leg. Rahim screams, "Keeper Keeper" letting the fielder know where the throw is supposed to be hurled back. Good man. er... Good boy.
beaten and almost stumped. Samuels comes down the track and is beaten in flight and then by the turn but he gets a outside edge to short third man region. Else he would have been a goner.
on the middle stump line, patted back to the bowler
leans forward to defend a full one on the off stump line
leans forward, works towards square-leg
on the off stump line, turns away, steered to point
Samuels breaks free. With a lovely pick-up shot. Flighted on the leg and middle, he cleared the left leg from the line and swung it over mid-on
leans forward and defends
faster, outside off stump, dabbed towards point for a quick single
on the off and middle, turns in, flicked to midwicket
on the off stump line, Chanders leans forward, works it past square-leg for a single.
slow, on the off stump line, no pace to work with and dabbed away to the off side

Gone. Flighted up, above the eye-level, it dips outside off stump, grips and turns away. Samuels drives loosely, gets a edge and is snapped up smartly by Rahim. It is a spin-friendly track and Sarwan walks in.
teasing line on the off stump, Sarwan lunges forward in defense. "Oh yes! Yes boy! yes boy!," shouts Rahim. hmm...
leans forward, drives to extra cover
stays back, punches a slightly short in length delivery to long on
on the off stump line, turns in, driven with the spin, down to long on
on the off and middle, defended on the front foot.
spin and bounce. Landed on the middle and turned past the defensive blade. Beaten comprehensively. Lots of turn on offer here.
gets off the strike with a single down to long off
stays back, punches to widish long on
quicker, on the off stump line, steered to point
on the off and middle, slightly short in length, Sarwan goes back, laps it past square-leg
comes in from outside off, pushed to point for a single.
slightly short, cut straight to point
leans forward to defend
quicker one, pushed back to the bowler
pushes towards cover for a quick single
on the middle peg, driven to widish mid-on for a single
slightly short, outside off stump, Chanderpaul shapes to cut and is beaten
walks across, paddles a full one to fine leg
on the middle and off, slightly short, Sarwan backs to cut to cover.

There comes the arm-ball. Lovely bit of bowling. Previous one lulled Sarwan into a false security and this one came crashing quick through the air and went on straight, Sarwan manages to bring his bat down in a hurry and stab it away to point
on the middle and leg, dabbed to the on side
on the off and middle, steered to point.
on the middle line, driven to long on
fullish, outside off stump, spins in, Chanders leans across, flicks it behind square
on the off stump line, pushes inside the line, runs off the outer edge, to backward point
eases forward, drives to long on
on the off stump line, turns, hit to midwicket
slightly short, outside off stump, not much turn and cut to deep point
slow in the air, straight, on the middle, defended towards cover
on the off stump line, another straight delivery, Sarwan waits , punches it inside-out to sweeper cover

shout for lbw. Quicker, and this one turns in from outside off. Chanders shuffles across and tries to work it to on side, misses and is struck outside off stump. IT was hitting the stumps but he was playing a stroke and the point of impact was outside off.
on the middle and leg, tickled to on side
on the off and middle, spins in, pushed back to the bowler
on the middle and leg, Sarwan goes back, turns it past square-leg for a single
turns in from outside off, worked to backward square-leg
Whoa! Chanderpaul hits a four. I am not lying. Tossed-up, outside off stump, driven through extra cover.
picks up a single with a cut to deep point
short but cut straight to point
almost caught at midwicket. It was slow in the air, turned in from off stump, Chanderpaul shaped to turn it to on side, is early in the stroke and almost scoops to midwicket.
turns to square-leg. Sarwan wants a run but is sent back
outside off stump, cut to backward point
goes back, wrists a full one past square-leg
comes down the track, drives to midwicket
on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
tossed-up, on the off stump line, Sars goes on a bent knee and no he didn't propose but swept it powerfully in front of square. Fab hit.
beaten. Goes for a cut but can't connect
comes down the track, is beaten in the flight and pads it away to the off side
on the off stump, straighter one, cut to point
on the off stump line, Chanders wants to turn it to on side, misses and it rolls away of the pad
flicked past square-leg for a single
tossed-up, on the middle stump line, driven insdie-out to long-off
quicker, outside off stump, delicately late cut through the vacant slip region. Very nicely played.
on the off and middle, worked to midwicket
slightly short and cut to sweeper cover
charges down the track and drives to long off
worked to right of midwicket for a single
drifted on middle and leg, driven to long on
on the middle stump line, punched to mid-on
short and outside off stump, cut with bit of outside edge through the vacant slip region
leans forwad, tickles to fine leg
slightlty short of length outside off stump, cut to deep point
beaten. short in length, outside leg stump and Sarwan backs away in an effort to cut and under edges it behind the stumps
full and flat on off stump, he comes across and turns it to short fine leg for the quickest of singles
comes in with the arm, he backs away to cut, and mistimes the shot to point
goes back, whips a fullish delivery to square-leg

edged past Rahim. It burshed the right pad of Rahim and ran down to third man. turning delivery outside off stump, Sarwan has a poke and it runs off the outer edge and rams into the right pad of the 'keeper who has no time to react.
spins into middle and leg, back he goes, nudging it into midwicket for one
tossed up, down he comes, making room to free the arms and lofting it over extra cover and bisecting two men in the deep
quicker and flatter on leg stump, tucked fine for one
tossed up on middle and off, he shuffles and dabs it in front of square leg
steps well outside leg stump, the bowler follows him flat, and he drives into the covers
tossed up full on off stump, flicked straight to short fine leg
fired into middle and off, he backs away to leg, skips down a step, and hits over the covers for six, lovely shot, all bottom hand
slower one, tossed up, he stands and chases it, beaten
comes out again, Saqibul fires it quick on the stumps, and Sarwan tucks it to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, flicked to square leg
comes out, Saqibul chases him with a quick one down leg, and he readjusts to defend
quick and flat outside off stump, he shuffles and cuts right to backward point
drifts down leg stump, he flicks but messes up
flatter on off stump, nicely flicked this time in the gap at midwicket for the single
flat down leg stump, arm ball goes wrong, Sarwan hustles to pull and just gets bat on it to roll it in the gap behind square for four
flat on the stump, worked square for one
tossed up outside off stump, he plays across the line and flicks to bring up his 50, well played, 46th of his career, needs to pick up the rate though
quicker spinning down leg stump, he lunges forward on the drive and gets rapped, bowlers yells out the appeal but turned down as it was clearly missing leg, inside-edge gets him one to the off side
quicker outside off stump, plays and misses
not missed this time! Just plants the leg forward and heaves across the line, timing it well over midwicket, powerful shot
short and wide, staying low but he cuts in the gap at point for one

cleaned 'em up! Aftab moves to around the wicket, bowls it on a good line marginally outside off stump, Chanderpaul slogs across the line and his off stump is disturbed, the change of bowling works for Bangladesh
Lara goes back, cuts late to short third man region
on the middle and leg, Sarwan waits, places it to midwicket region for a single
beaten. Appeal for a catch behind. on a length, outside off stump and it went straight, Lara tried to cut it late, his bat hit the ground and that was the noise that Rahim went up for.
turns to square-leg region for a single
arm-ball, on the off and middle, dabbed away to off side. Lara wanted a run, Rahim rushed forward, picked the ball and Lara retreated
turned to vacant midwicket region. Once again its Rahim who charges after it, can't prevent a single this time
fuller, on the off stump line, Lara goes on the front foot, opens the bat-face and guides it to short third man
Meanwhile Sarwan gets his fifty with a dab to point. He is being tipped to take over as the captain
worked to square leg for a single
driven to cover where Saqib makes a tumbling stop
tossed-up, driven to long on
Another drive to long on. Another single.
on the off stump line, driven to left of the bowler
on the off and middle, pushed to extra cover
full and on the middle and leg, swept away to long leg
picks a single with a dab towards mid-on. The bowler goes after it and Rahim screams, "keeper keeper!" but Rafique doesn't oblige
cut to point. 150 up. West Indies are spluttering on.
full-pitched outside off stump, square-driven to backward point, fumble there and they pinch a single
fullish, on the middle, Lara glides forward, drives past the bowler to right of long on
Shocker! Way down the leg side. Rahim, standing up to the stumps, can't get across in time.
full and on the off stump line, driven to left of long off where Aftab makes the stop
on the off stump line, Sarwan eases it towards deep cover
yorker-length, on the middle, driven towards long on
full-pitched on the middle, single down to long on
flicked to square-leg for a single
full and outside off, Lara wants to cut but can't connect
will get a single this time with a nudge towards square-leg. Had it been there a direct hit he might well have been in trouble.
Again he tries to cut it late and is beaten.
Deja-vu. And again. Too cute for his own comfort.

It should have been a run out! Rudi Koertzen didn't refer it upstairs. Pity. overpitched on the leg stump line, flicked to midwicket. Saqib  swooped on the ball and fired in a direct hit. Sarwan is just short of the crease but there was not a huge appeal and Rudi didn't go upstairs. hmm..
drives to widish long on
Low full toss and that has disappeared to deep midwicket boundary. He thrusted his front foot and swung it over midwicket
fullish, Lara is looking for some quick runs here, takes out the front leg and drives down to long on
outside off stump, Sarwan eases it to sweeper cover.
This is a biggie. Another low full toss, on the leg stump line, another swing of the blade from Lara and the white ball soared into the deep midwicket stands.
beaten. Outside off stump, spins away, Sarwan tries to drive inside-out ....
on a length, on the middle, goes on straight, dabbed towards point
full-pitched on the middle stump line, driven towards midwicket for a quick single
on the middle and leg, Sarwan shuffles across, tickles it to fine-leg
on the off and middle stump line, driven back to the bowler
comes down the track, drags back the length, Lara adjusts well, turns it past square-leg and they rush across and will have time to come back for two.
outside off stump, full in length, Sarwan tries to cut but the ball bounces over the blade
slightly slower and wider outside off stump, cut down to widish third man. They settle for a single.
kicks up from short of length, slants away from Lara who had opened his stance up and shaped to pull it but withdraws from the shot

Wow. That scintillating whiplash square-drive from the master. Maximum. It was fullish and outside off, Lara whipped it away off the front foot and it flew over point. Mortaza looks stunned. That was a great trademark shot from  Lara. As Sambit Bal wrote long time back, "For bliss, song, dance and  glory who else but Brian Lara."
fullish, on the stumps, square-driven through cover point

And Lara falls. He comes down the track and drives powerfully but straight to cover. Lara walks back. This is probably his penultimate knock in the ODIs. There was a gem of whiplash square-drive for six and that is that. He is gone now. West Indies slid further.
on the middle and leg, full, flicked behind square leg
short, quick, on the middle and off, punched to cover
drifts on to the legs, tickled behind square for a single
quicker, on the legs, Bravo tries to flick it, misses and it runs off the pad to the leg side
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
kicks up from short of length, outside off stump, Bravo hops up, gets on top of the bounce, dabs it towards backward point. 200 up.
full-pitched, comes in from off stump line, Sarwan pats it gently back down the track. Mortaza picks up the ball, has a look at the batsman and turns back
Skilful strike. Overpitched, outside off and Sarwan leant on to it, and drove it inside-out to widish long off region.
low full toss outside off stump, sliced straight to sweeper cover. Missed an opportunity there.
overpitched on the middle stump line, driven to long on

slower one, outside off stump, Sarwan backs away, waits, carves it to left of deep point and runs hard to come back for two. Had the throw been accurate at the striker's end, things could have gone interesting
short and it hastened on straight off the turf, Bravo is beaten by the pace and the bounce as he shapes to pull, dabs it to on side for a quick single
comes down the track, drives, gets a inside edge to square-leg. Rahim, the 'keeper, rushes after it. Bravo runs the first run hard, pushes for the second and Sarwan responds
Clubbed away. Down went Sarwan on his knee, down came the flashing blade and he connected well with his slog sweep and it flew over widish long on
outside off stump, sliced away to left of deep point where Ashraful makes a diving stop near the ropes
charges down the track, drives inside out to left of sweeper cover
Fab hit. Full and on the stumps, Sarwan backed away, chipped it inside-out over extra cover. Ashraful gets across to make the stop. Very well placed.
full-pitched outside off stump, driven down the ground. Two runs.
slower one outside off stump, Bravo waits, opens the bat-face, runs it to third man
Length-delivery on the off and middle, Sarwan wants to pull but doesn't time it well and it goes straight to midwicket
Bravo comes down the track, Mortaza fires it full at yorker-length, driven to long off for a single.
swat. Length-delivery, outside off stump, Sarwan tries to flat-bat it , mistimes it towards extra cover. that's that. He won't get to his ton.

comes down the track, has a wild swing across the line, gets a outer edge down to third man. Bravo comes half-way down the track for the second run, the tired Sarwan is not interested and Bravo retreats.

inn2.comm: Collymore starts off right on target. In the channel outside off stump, hint of away movement and Javed Omar, who has an open-stance, leans across and lets it go through to 'keeper
tip and run. On the off stump line, Javed pats it close on the off side and they steal a single. The Bangladeshi fans, in the crowd, look pretty happy. Cheering and clapping.

Lara has dropped a sitter. And how. It flew straight to him at second slip, it went to his mid-riff and he held it. Immediately, took a step to his right and just as he was about to throw it up, it rolled out of his hands. Collymore was celebrating  in his three-fingured salute. Lara looked aghast. He looked at the umpire as if to say he was in control of the ball. He didn't look too convinced himself and that has been ruled not out. It was deemed that he was not in control.

It was a length-delivery outside off stump and Tamim had a flash at it.
fuller, on the middle and leg, turned to square-leg
on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
hits the deck short of length, outside off stump and it kicked up, Tamim shaped to cut and the ball bounced over the blade
rushes past the off stump, Javed withdraws his bat from the line and lets it go past him
homing in on the off stump, pushed to cover. Javed walks towards the square-leg. Practices a straight-drive. He wants to make sure his bat comes down straight.
cut and a miss. Short of length,  outside off stump, Omar went for a cut but missed
bouncer. Kicks up and flies past the right shoulder of Javed who drops his wrists. Another walk towards square-leg, this time he practices swaying away.
Fullish, on the off stump line, Omar drives to cover.
outside off, Omar lunges forward and shoulders arms as the ball veers away
beaten. Collymore continues to tease the outside edge of Tamim. In the zone outside off and Tamim tries to drive on the up
Full and outside off, Tamim lets it go past him this time.
Good bounce. Kicked up from short of length, reared up at the ribs, Tamim takes the bottom-hand off the handle, dabs it in front of him
gets behind the line of a length-delivery and defends
full in length, just outside off stump, Tamim leans back, punches it down to third man
full in length, on the middle and off, moves in towards middle. Javed leans forward, offers the full face of the bat in defense
on the off stump line, mistimes a drive towards mid-off
hits the deck short of length, climbs up outside the off stump, Omar hops up, pushes at it , bat well away from the body, and is beaten
fuller, on the middle and leg, worked to square-leg
fullish, outside off stump and driven on the up, through the line but straight to mid-off
rises up at the ribs, Omar shuffles inside, hops, tries to tickle it fine, misses and the ball rushes down the leg side
length-delivery on the off and middle stump line, Tamim hops up, gets on top of the bounce and pushes it extra cover
full and in the zone outside off, Tamim tries to crash it through cover and is once again beaten. He is playing dangerously here. Lots of hits and misses.
is conservative this time and shoulders arms at a delivery outside off
on the middle and off stump line, kicks up a touch and Tamim is surprised at the extra bounce, adjusts by taking the bottom-hand off the handle, dabs it to the off side
beaten again. Length-delivery outside off stump, he stays beside the line and tries to square-drive on the up but the extra bounce beats him.

Oh ho. He charges down the track and tries to heave a back of length delivery across the line but misses. He has always been in trouble when he has tried to swing to the leg side while coming down the track. Creams them very well through the off side but somehow doesn't get in any sort of position when he tries to hit on the leg side.
slips down the leg side
length-delivery, cutting in from outside off stump, Omar shaped to cut, was surprised at the nip-backer, but manages to chop it away to third man
Another edge. Falls short of Lara, at second slip, and he is unable to stop it. Landed on a length, angled away from Tamim, who pushes at it, bat away from the body.
slightly short, outside off and cut well to widish third man
short in length, on the middle, Tamim hops up but the ball doesn't rise as much as he expected and pushed it down the track
Snorter. Kicked up and rose over  the shoulder in the off stump line. Tamim hops up, tries to steer it over the slips but the ball kept climbing and he couldn't reach it
Edged over Lara - it's all happenning around him- at second slip. Short in length and climbing, outside the off stump, Tamim flashes it over the slip.
drifts down the leg side.
on the middle stump line, again extra bounce, Omar hops up, gets on top of the bounce and defends

What a way to go. Unbelievably school-boyish dismissal. Length-delivery on the off and middle line, Omar dabbed it close on the off side and both set off for a run. Bravo swooped in from point and suddenly, Tamim froze half-way down the track and tried to turn back. But Javed Omar kept running on and reached the other end first. Meanwhile Bravo picks the ball up, looks up and seems surprised there is no one at the striker's end. He jogs towards it and removes the bails.
outside off stump, left alone
lovely cover drive. Full and outside off, he leaned forward and drove it through cover
on the stumps, turned to square-leg
short in length again, on the off stump line, Omar goes back, dabs it to cover
on the off and middle, tries to turn it to leg side, misses and it bobs away off the pad to the off side. Aftab calls for a run and they make it
fuller, outside off stump, Aftab tries to cover drive, edges it, along the ground, to third man
leans forward, pushes a length-delivery to point
on the middle and leg, kicks up from short of length, Omar doubles up as the ball cuts back in and rams in to his thigh pad. This is very good bowling from Powell. He has had a pretty good WC
In the channel, outside off, left alone
dug in short and Aftab shaped to pull and lapped it around the corner towards long leg
on the off stump line, Omar leans forward, turns the bat-face, steers the length-delivery towards point
Again Lara comes into play. Another edge that flew low to his right and he dived but it fell short. A nice probing length-delivery around off, Omar pushed at it even as it straightened.
leans forward, punches a length-delivery past the bowler, past mid-on. Mere push. Sweetly timed.

Collymore removes Aftab. Lovely seam-position, seam facing the slips and it landed on a length, just outside off stump and shaped away. Aftab hang his bat out at it and it took a bit of outside edge before nestling into the 'keeper's gloves. Collymore can finally celebrate. The ball has not slipped out of the fielder. Lara rushes to congratulate him. Smiles all round.
welcomes him with a bouncer. Ducked under.
homing in on the off stump, Omar thrusts his front foot across, stabs it away to point
hops up as the ball bounces over the off stump and jabs it close on the off side. Looks for a single, its not there, realises it and gets back.
around the off stump again, Omar opens the bat-face and guides it past Bravo at backward point, down to third man
at the hips. tucked straight to square-leg
on the middle stump line, gets behind the line, pushes it back to the bowler
fuller, on the off stump line, moves away a touch, Saqibul opens up, guides it to cover
beaten. In the zone, landed on the seam and straightened, Omar pushes at it, bat goes inside the line and the ball flirts with the outside edge
further away from the off stump and Omar lets it go without a fuss
on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
climbs up from a length, on the off stump line and holds its line, Omar is troubled by the extra bounce, tries to rise with the delivery, ball gets big on him and he jabs it away to third man

Collymore on fire for Windies. Done in by the extra bounce. Landed on the seam, around the off stump line, kicked up, more than what Saqibul expected as he shaped for a on-the-up square-drive, gets the edge and flies to Ramdin. West Indies are on top here.
full and on the off stump line, Ashraful gets confidently in line, drives to mid-off
full-pitched, on the middle and leg, it swung late in the air, Omar tries to flick it away but misses and it thuds into the pad.
Take that! Where did that come from. Omar smokes a length-delivery, outside off stump, on the up, through cover. Hit on the up. Bottom-hand powered drive.
shuffles across, covers the off stump and shoulders arms

banged in short, it rears up at the throat, Omar hops up, takes the eyes of the ball, the ball climbs up further and stings at him, he adjusts by taking the bottom-hand off and fends it off to the on side.
on the middle and leg, Omar jumps, turns it to square-leg
on the off and middle, defended on the back foot
shuffles across, gets behind a length-delivery around off and pushes it out to the off side
short in length, on the middle, bounces even as it straightens, again Omar is on the hop. Gets on top of the bounce and defends.
fuller, on the middle stump line, shapes in, Omar is bit late to lean forward, does so eventually, gets a inside-edge past square-leg
full-pitched outside off stump, driven to cover
fullish length outside the off stump, Javed Omar drives on the up past mid-off
good length ball on off stump, Omar plays back in his crease and defends
a touch wider outside the off stump this time, Omar waits for it and cuts it down to third man
full length delivery on off stump, Ashraful gets behind the line and drives on the front foot to mid off
Taylor drops this shorter outside off stump, Ashraful drops his wrists and lets it go
left alone once more through to Ramdin behind the stumps

dropped. good length ball outside off stump, Javed Omar reaches for it and tries to run it down to third man, he gets a thick outside edge that flies to the right of Brian Lara at second slip, Lara dives full stretch to the right and gets a hand on it but can't hold on, difficult chance that
defended off his hips on the leg side
a touch shorter in length and Ashraful chips it on the up and over cover for two more

caught at square leg, Powell drops it a fraction short, Ashraful goes back and tries to hit over the in field, he's in no position whatsoever to play a pull and the ball hits the high part of the bat before spooning up to Samuels who takes the simplest of catches
good length ball defended on the back foot
fuller ball outside off, Bashar goes down on one knee and tries to drive, he hits it hard into the ground towards cover point
full length delivery that swings back into Javed Omar, he gets on to the front foot and drives wide of Chanderpaul at mid off who moves quickly to his left and saves runs
good length ball jags back into Bashar from off stump, he plays back in his crease and gets hit on the pad
defended on the back foot towards cover
good length once again, angling into the right-hander from off stump, Bashar presses forward and gets an inside edge on to the leg side
on the off and middle, defended on the off side
back of length, on the off and middle again, Bashar shapes to pull, ends up swatting it towards midwicket

Another one goes down. Again done by the extra bounce.  Omar falls after offering some resistance. Hits the deck short of length, outside the off stump and it holds its line. Omar hops up, stabs at it, bat away from the body, with an open-face of the bat and it flies to the left of first slip where Gayle takes it.
wide down the leg side
screaming bouncer and Rahim ducks under
beaten. Fuller, outside off stump and Rahim decides late to go for a drive but Powell has the keys. He makes the ball move away and Rahim is beaten
lets this one go past the off stump.
full, on the middle and off, pushes at it, gets a outside edge, down to third man
leans forward, drives to mid-off
length-delivery on the off stump line, pushed to extra cover for a single
full and on the leg and middle, turned to square-leg
overpitched outside off, Bashar is reluctant to get forward, square-drives it past point

Lara drops a very tough chance to his right at slips. Length-delivery outside off stump, Bashar stays beside the line, drives loosely, gets a edge and it flies to the right of Lara. He flings himself full length, parallel to the ground but can't hold on to it.  Can we leave the poor chap alone  for a while please? Everything seems to be going at  him. The catches, the critics and the critical fans
.short in length, defended on the back foot
short in length, punched to cover point
at the hips,. dabbed away to the on side
shortish, rises up chest-high, at the off stump line, Rahim gets behind the line and defends.
rises up from short of length, outside off stump, Rahim goes back and across, steers to backward point for a single.
fullish, slipping on the legs, glanced away to fine leg
full in length, outside off stump, coming in a tad, Rahim moves in line, drives on the up, past point

Ouch. banged in short, on off and middle and the habitual Basher shapes for the pull, is too early in the stroke and the ball arrives later and thuds into his back. He had completely swivelled around by then.
full and on the middle, again Rahim gets perfectly behind the line and defends solidly
fuller, on the middle and leg, Rahim moves across, flicks it to square-leg. He is now practising a straight drive.
on the off and middle, eased towards point
Fullish, on the off and middle, shapes in, Rahim goes back and across, pats it to the on side. Bravo gets across, makes the stop. Sarwan has a smile and a chat with Bravo.
And again. Bravo lets Sarwan, coming in from mid-on, pick the ball. Gets it from him and walks back to the top of his run-up
fuller, on the middle, pushed back down the track, Bravo lunges to his right to make the stop and Rahim retreats quickly. For all the curious cats out there, Bravo didn't throw.
on the legs, flicked past square-leg
banged in short, at the body, Bashar takes out the left leg from the line, opens-up and pulls it in front of  square-leg
bouncer and he ducks under. They are feeding him bumpers hoping he would make the mistake with the pull

The captain is gone. Smiles all around the West Indies camp. Pace and bounce gets them again. And again. Banged in short, it kicks up around the off stump line, chest-high at a rapid pace, Bashar has no where to go, he hops, takes the bottom-hand off the handel, puts his bat at it as a shield, it collides with the outer edge and flies over Bravo at third slip and he times his jump nicely to grab it.
fuller, on the off stump line, pushed to cover point
Full in the channel outside off, left alone
half-volley on the leg and middle, flicked past square-leg. He leant it very nicely on to it.
Even better. Crisply driven through extra cover. Again fullish and he creamed it through cover. Eye-catching stroke.
here comes the response. Bouncer. Ducked under. Bravo stares at the batsman but Mortaza is not looking at his direction.
And here comes his slower delivery. On the off and middle, Mortaza spots it, works it towards square-leg
Another bouncer. Another no ball. Down the leg side, Mortaza shaped to pull it but couldn't get a touch.

Ouch! Snorter. Gets the bouncer right this time. At the throat, you don't want a hard leather ball there. Mortaza jumps, sees the ball rearing at him, shuts his eye and gets into a contortion but somehow manages to fend it away to the on side.
length-delivery, on the off and middle, patted back down the track
gets behind the line nicely to a length-delivery on the off stump line and defends
extra bounce. Climbs up outside off stump, Rahim goes back and across, dabs it to third man. He adjusted very nicely to the extra bounce. Rised with it.

I think Mortaza was expecting a short one as he didn't quite get behind the line of this one. It was full in length, on the middle and he chose to stay beside the line and then at the last minute shuffles across to defend

edged over the slips. Yep, you guessed it another one that bounced more than the batsman expected. Kicked up from short of length, outside off, held its line and Mortaza's bat came down vertically, it should have been horizontal and the ball took the outside edge and flew over the slip nest
fuller and Mortaza jumps at it as a thirsty man would do at the sight of H2O. He leans forward and drives uppishly through cover.
on the hips, Rahim shuffles inside, glances it to fine leg. He is playing very well out there. Adjusting to the bounce and getting behind the line.
on the off and middle, bounces a touch, pushed back down the track
slightly short in length, Mortaza unfurls the horizontal shot this time but mistimes the cut to point. But at least, he is getting the right idea.
Crack! Slower one, outside off stump, sits up nicely outside off stump and Mortaza slices it over point
The response? Bouncer. Mortaza ducks under in a hurry, loses balance and falls on his back. He springs up quickly and walks towards square-leg.
on the middle stump line, slightly short, Mortaza wants to pull but doesn't connect well and the ball rolls in front of him

shout for lbw. It was full in length - he has been hitting the short of length for some time, on the off stump line, Rahim is little surprised, shapes to drive, the bat comes outside the line, the ball sneaks in and thuds into the back pad. In front of the off stump. The umpire must have thought it hit him outside the line.
shuffles across, tucks a length-delivery at the hips, to square-leg
lands on a length, on the off and middle, Rahim pushes forward, eases it to wide of mid-on
Thwack. The horizontal bat shot does the trick. Short and outside off stump, Mortaza rocks back and cuts it past cover point.
banged in short, on the leg stump line, Rahim shuffles across, tries to tickle it fine but misses
another bouncer, outside off stump, Rahim goes back and across, drops his wrists nicely and gets his bat away from the line, even as he sways away. Very well done.
on the middle stump line, Rahim gets behind the line, works it to square-leg
fuller, on the middle and leg, turned to square-leg

slightly slower, outside off stump, Rahim eases it to left of Samuels at backward point who makes a neat sliding stop. And what's more, has a shy at the non-striker's end, misses but Mortaza was made to hurry to get back to his crease.
on the off and middle line, on a length, pushed to cover
Tough caught and bowled chance missed. Driven on the up, and it goes low, bootlaces height, at Powell who tries to bend down but can't get down in time.
way down the leg side
on the off and middle, moves inside the line, pushes it to cover point
on the leg side, glanced away
will retain the strike with a nudge past square-leg
beaten. Outside off stump and Mortaza pushes at it
More forceful this time. Leans forward and drives to long off
slow in the air, slower off the turf, well outside off stump, cut to deep point
on the middle stump line, clipped past square-leg for a single
tossed-up, outside off stump, square-driven to backward point
slightly short, outside off, cut to Samuels at backward point
length-delivery on the off stump line, Mortaza stays beside the line, square-drives it to point
Fuller, on the off stump line, Mortaza square-drives it past point.
banged in short, on the middle, Mortaza backs away a touch, as he continues to play adjacent to the line and not behind it, and punches it to cover
So Bravo hurls in a bouncer, at the leg and middle stump line this time and Mortaza responds by ducking. Good contest.
ooh... swing and a miss. Fuller this time and Mortaza' eyes lit up at the length and went for a drive but the ball didn't rise much and it went below the bat.
quick single with a push towards mid-off
quick and flat, he lunges forward, opens the bat face and steers it wide of slip for a quick single
flatter outside off stump, he chases it and misses
tossed up, and there's a confident front-foot drive to mid-off
tossed up wider, he steers it to slip on the ground
tossed up, he comes out and drives to mid-on
tossed up outside off stump, he gets well forward and defends to cover
good length outside off stump, he leans forward compactly and steers it to third man for one
back of a length just outside off stump, he hops up and defends, getting an inside-edge to leg
bouncer over the left shoulder as he ducks the head out of the way
back of a length on the stumps, he gets forward, surprised by the bounce, and manages to jam it down before square leg
short and wide, he crunches it hard off the back foot but Lara at point flings himself to his right and cuts it off
slower full toss on off stump, easily whipped out to the deep past square leg and midwicket for a couple
tossed up on off stump, he shuffles and taps it to leg
tossed up, he gets forward and defends
tossed up once more, and he defends back down the track
tossed up outside off stump this time, and he pushes into the covers
flatter and shorter, he gets up and steers it to backward point
tossed up, comes forward and drives to point
bouncer and ducked under
on the off and middle, punched to cover
short, at the body, pulled to long leg
on the off stump line, Rahim gets behind the line, defends towards point. Wants a single but is sent back. He has a chat with Mortaza.
fuller, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
Aha! Spanking pull shot in front of square. Banged in short and he got into position early and slapped it.
full and on the middle, driven powerfully down to long on
outside off stump, turns in, Rahim shuffles right across the stumps, tucks it behind square-leg
spins in from outside off stump, Mortaza stabs at it, gets a outside edge to third man region
outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover
flighted delivery, outside off and swept powerfully to deep midwicket
short and outside off, Rahim goes back, punches it to deep point
yorker-length, on the middle stump line, jabbed away with a bit of outside edge to the off side
fullish, on the middle and off, driven to mid-off
fullish, outside off stump, pushed to cover
slower one, full in length, outside the off stump, Rahim waits for it and square-drives it to deep point
short and slipping down the leg side, Mortaza wants to lap it around the corner but doesn't get a touch
Again dug in short, on the leg and middle line, Mortaza walks across the stumps and tries to pull it fine but again meets air.

cleaned him up with a yorker. Mortaza, after a fine resistance, falls. Full, on the middle stump line, and hint of late inswing, Mortaza is caught at the crease, his feet in a tangle, the bat comes down in an angle and the ball squeezes past it to crash into the furniture.
outside off stump, from round the stumps, again Rahim shuffles right across, and tucks it to square-leg region
on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
beaten. Full and outside off, Rafique has a go but no contact
And again. Outside off stump and he goes for a cut this time but ...
fuller, quicker, on the off stump line, jabbed away to cover

arm-ball, from round the stumps, does the trick. Full in length, lands outside off stump, Rafique goes back, instead of pressing forward, and the ball comes in with the arm, the bat comes outside the line and he is caught dead plumb in front.
on a length, outside off stump, Rahim shapes to cut - not the length for it and is beaten
on the off stump line, Rahim gets right behind the line and defends
full and well outside the off stump, Rahim goes down on his knee and tries a extravagant square-cut but the wood doesn't make contact with leather
leans forward to defend solidly
slower delivery, outside off stump, slightly short, Rahim waits for it to arrive, cuts down to third man
length-delivery on the off stump line, defended to the off side
slightly short, outside off stump, cut to deep point. Razzak dropped his bat after he reached the other end, and wanted to turn back for a second run but Rahim sends him back.
leans forward, defends
He goes for a drive outside off and is beaten
really slow in the air, comes in from outside off, pushed to cover
flighted delivery on the middle, nurdled to fine leg
bouncer, rears above chest high. Razzak is surprised at the lift, hops up, takes his eyes off and fends it away.
length-delivery on the off stump line, Razzak hops up again, there was no need to, the ball rose only thigh-high and he dabs it to off side
fuller, outside off, mistimes a drive to off side

Lara takes a catch! he has a huge smile spread across his visage. Finally, something goes well for him. Length-delivery, slanting away from Razzak who tries to withdraw his bat away but is late in doing so and ends up patting it to Lara at second slip. He doesn't make any mistake this time. Bravo celebrates and Lara rushes towards him. All the Windies players converge on the duo. The sun is shining and the weather is sweet for the West Indians. Lara took the catch and only after taking a few steps, released the ball gently towards the square-leg umpire. He was not going to repeat that mistake.
fullish, outside off stump, jabbed away to cover
kicks up from short of length, swayed away from the line
on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
tossed-up, slow through the air, pushed to extra cover
fullish, driven to long off

Flighted-up,on the off stump line, Rahim goes down on his knee and slog swept it high over midwicket. Devon Smith, who was inside the ropes, got across to his left and gave up the ghost, thinking it was flying over the ropes. It landed just inside.
slightly short, he moves nicely back and across, cuts past backward point
on the legs, flicked past square-leg
slower one, he waits on the front foot and spanks it down the ground.
full and outside off stump, dabbed down to third man
on the off stump line, slightly short, cut past point
on the middle stump line, worked to right of midwicket for a easy single
yorker-length, outside off stump, jabbed away, with a bit of outside edge, to second slip
from round the stumps, floated outside off, driven to cover
tossed up on the middle, paddled away fto short fine leg
lands on the middle stump, goes on with the arm, pushed to the off side. Bravo, at first slip, thought he would go for a paddle again and moved to his left
outside off stump, driven past cover
arm-ball, on the middle and off, jabs at it, gets a inside-edge on to the front pad
floated on the off stump line, pushed to cover
dug in short, outside off stump, Rahim shapes to pull but ends up swatting it to mid-on
backs away to the leg side and tries to cut a  full in length outside offstump and is beaten
overpitched outside off stump, drilled to sweeper cover
bouncer on the middle and leg, ducks under. There is a leg gully in place.
edged between third slip and gully. Fullish, outside off, has a flash at it and gets a thick outside edge
full-pitched on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
full and outside off, tries to steer it away past slip but is beaten
tossed-up, full, backs away to the leg side, tries to slog it over cover, gets a inside-edge to the leg side
leans forward to defend
West Indies have won. A Comprehensive victory. They win by 99 runs. Slow in the air, flighted, on the middle and Rasel tries to slog it across the line, misses and the middle stump is pegged back.
